instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .

threads.title: 3115 changed out bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, now no display and full fan 1/4 spin fixed though
threads.message: Changed out a non water damaged <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> ona 3115causing 1/4 fan spin.  Fan now spins at full speed (at least its a step in the right direction). Problem is that it runs at full speed, and I now have no backlight/display. no obvious damage to the board, all looks well around LED driver.  Is the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> related in some way to fan speed (like mouse issue) and/backlight? No voltage at screen connector, no display or backlight on known good screens.

threads.title: 3115 changed out bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, now no display and full fan 1/4 spin fixed though
threads.message: What about external display?? Does it chime?? What voltage do you have on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: 3115 changed out bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, now no display and full fan 1/4 spin fixed though
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 7088"]What about external display?? Does it chime?? What voltage do you have on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL>??[/QUOTE]
[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] 

0 v

Should that be present always? What causes that circuit to die? There was no water damage, <RESISTOR>R7510</RESISTOR> measures correctly.

threads.title: 3115 changed out bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, now no display and full fan 1/4 spin fixed though
threads.message: I bet there was nothing wrong with <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. You actually made it worse by changing <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> cause now there is no CPU Vcore at all. When it did the 1/4 fan spin it did have Vcore but was shutting down because of another issue.
